node.title: Serko 'burning cash' as it prepares for growth out of pandemic
node.description: The travel software company's chief executive says it's poised for growth as more normal travel conditions resume.

node.title: Elizabeth Holmes Points Fingers at Others and Says She Was a Believer
node.description: In her most substantial day of testimony, Ms. Holmes, the founder of the failed blood testing start-up Theranos, painted herself as someone whose best intentions were misinterpreted.

node.title: The new German government plans to legalize cannabis.
node.description: In Germany it’s not illegal to consume marijuana but it is illegal to buy it. That may change.

node.title: Migrant Crisis at Poland’s Border Eases Pressure on Its Government
node.description: The governing Law and Justice party’s tough stance on migrants seeking to enter the E.U. from Belarus has lifted its popularity, which had taken blows from Covid and rising inflation.

node.title: Republicans, Democrats Locked in Dead Heat in Latest Congressional Ballot Poll
node.description: The two parties each received 40 percent of support from American adults in a survey that was conducted November 20-23.

node.title: 48.3 Million Traveling for Thanksgiving as U.S. Averages 100,000 COVID Cases a Day: AAA
node.description: Last Friday, more than 2.2 million people flying across the U.S. went through airport security. It was the busiest travel day since the pandemic started.

node.title: Texas Gun Store Holds 'Not Guilty' Sale Following Rittenhouse Verdict
node.description: "We are celebrating the life that Kyle Rittenhouse now gets to live because he was able to defend himself without being penalized for it," the store said.

node.title: Mandate legislation pushed through Parliament amid fierce opposition
node.description: Legislation that will replace the current alert levels with the traffic light system has passed its final reading in the House.

node.title: Covid-19 wrap: MIQ changes and traffic light legislation
node.description: There were 215 new Covid-19 cases announced today, the country's most restrictive border controls will be eased early next year, and MPs pass traffic light legislation.

node.title: Samsung to build a new semiconductor facility in Texas
node.description: The $17 billion chip factory is largest U.S. investment ever by the South Korean electronics giant, it said.

node.title: It’s Beginning to Look a Lot Like Holiday Social Anxiety
node.description: Even in the best of times, social gatherings can be overwhelming. If you’re feeling less-than-festive, here’s how to ease into the season.

node.title: Art Basel Miami Beach Returns, Smaller but Ready to Party
node.description: What you’ll find at this year’s tropical circus: hundreds of galleries, institutions proudly exhibiting homegrown work and an array of NFT-themed gatherings.

node.title: The head of Instagram agrees to testify as Congress probes the app’s effects on young people.
node.description: This will be the first time Adam Mosseri, a trusted lieutenant to Mark Zuckerberg, will testify to lawmakers under oath.

node.title: British Lawmaker Is Reprimanded for Bringing Her Baby to a Debate
node.description: Stella Creasy received a letter of complaint for attending a debate with her infant son in tow. After an outcry, the speaker of the House of Commons said that a committee would review the rules.

node.title: NASA Curiosity Rover Captures Spectacular Images of Mars Landscape
node.description: Curiosity has been exploring the red planet and gathering scientific data for almost a decade, having touched down on the surface on August 5, 2012.

node.title: Hubble Spots Superhot Shockwave Coming From Running Man Nebula
node.description: The blast from deep space, known as a Herbig-Haro object, is thought to have come from a newborn star.

node.title: Why tapping oil reserves may not do much to curb gas prices
node.description: White House plan aims to offer relief to millions of motorists. But the gains are likely to be modest, according to experts.

node.title: ‘Resident Evil: Welcome to Raccoon City’ Review: They Go Way Back
node.description: Set in 1998, this franchise origin story embraces nostalgia.

node.title: A Fix-It Job for Government Tech
node.description: To build trust in the government, it would help if the website worked.

node.title: Space Pagans and Smartphone Witches: Where Tech Meets Mysticism
node.description: The internet allows us to discover, select and combine the spiritual traditions that suit us best. In a new exhibition, artists are exploring the connections between ancient beliefs and futuristic systems.

node.title: Migrants Feared Dead After Boat Capsizes in English Channel
node.description: The boat, which was carrying the migrants to Britain, capsized near Calais. The French authorities said “many” people had died in the accident.

node.title: When Is Cyber Monday? 2021 Date, Early Deals and History
node.description: Cyber Monday is on the horizon and will follow up Black Friday with bargains galore! Here is all you need to know about the event, including when it starts.

node.title: Emaciated Humpback Whale That Died Entangled in Fishing Gear Found in Massachusetts
node.description: A necropsy revealed that the whale had an empty stomach, a sign of "chronic entanglement."

node.title: Do We Get Paid Early for Thanksgiving? How the Federal Holiday Affects Your Paycheck
node.description: Many banks, including the Federal Reserve, are closed on federal holidays. Does this mean workers get paid early for Thanksgiving?

node.title: 20 Italian Towns Put Into Lockdown as Effort to Control COVID Spread
node.description: Bars and restaurants in the towns must close after 6 p.m. and residents must comply with a nighttime curfew between 8 p.m. and 5 a.m.

node.title: EU Eyes Sanctions for Airlines, Tourism Companies Aiding Migrants Entrance to Belarus
node.description: The sanctions are expected to be approved by EU leaders in the coming days.

node.title: Russia Wants to Broker an Iran-Saudi Deal and Biden Doesn't Seem to Mind
node.description: "Neither the United States nor Russia is interested in having this war," Vitaly Naumkin, co-author of Moscow's Persian Gulf security plan, told Newsweek.

node.title: Large Ice Cream Manufacturer Faces Boycotts for Raising Wage of Vaccinated Workers
node.description: Chapman's Ice Cream Company is offering a $1-per-hour raise for employees that get vaccinated by the end of the month.

node.title: Winter COVID Surge Starts Hitting States With High Vaccination Rates
node.description: Of the states seeing the largest uptick in COVID-19 cases, only two have vaccinated fewer than 70 percent of its adult population.

node.title: IRS Reports 25 Percent of Workforce Got COVID Vaccine After Biden Mandate Issued
node.description: Monday was the deadline for 3.5 million federal workers to get their first COVID-19 shot, and 92 percent reported that they were at least partially vaccinated.
